title: WINDOWS AND TABS OPEN BEFORE UPDATE TO VERSION 137.0.2 (64-bit) DISAPPEARED AFTER THE UPDATE
content:
Firefox closed the browser for an automatic update two days ago, and when it came up back after the update all my open windows and tabs simply disappeared. History tab was reset to a blank page, there was no trace of anything. I tried the access through 'Menu / History / Recently closed windows' or '.../ Recently closed tabs' and they were both blank, empty, zero, nada ... This is the first time it happens to me, and I'm surprised and disappointed that such a predictable and basic bug shows up on an update.

I have a couple dozen tabs I use for task f-ups, it' unproductive and annoying to get them all back up to work. If this happens again I doubt I keep using Firefox as my preferred browser.

  1. Anybody else suffering the same issue?
  2. Is there a cure for the problem?
creator: terraces

title: bookmarks
content:
Yesterday 04-24-25 I had one tab open, I opened another tab to go to a differant website and the Bookmarks file folder was empty. I went back to the original tab and only one file still had bookmarks in it and when I tried to add others or export the manage bookmarks only showed about 10 to 15 bookmarks still in ALL of Firefox. There had been at least 100. When I try to add bookmarks or modify the few left It goes though the steps but makes no changed or additions to the few files that are left. So the bookmarks option has toally stopped working. 

I ran both Norton and BitDefender(downloaded to see if Norton missed a Virus) Neither came back with a Virus.   WTF guys?

title: Cookie AutoDelete werkt anders/niet
content: Beste, Hoop dat gewoon in Nederlands goed is. Gisteren heb ik Firefox 'opgefrist', met de button daarvoor. Alle Add-ons was ik kwijt en ik moest ook verder alles opnieuw instellen. Dat was al vervelend, er was geen melding daarover als je dat deed. In ieder geval, ik heb onder andere mijn geliefde Cookie AutoDelete weer toegevoegd, maar kon die verder niet instellen, zoals ik eerder kon aangeven dat cookies tien seconden na het sluiten van een tabblad moeten worden verwijderd. Verder lijkt het alsof cookies überhaupt niet worden verwijderd, want als ik met diverse websites wat testjes doe en die tabbladen sluit om vervolgens die websites in nieuwe tabbladen te openen, zie ik allereerst niet dat prettige CAD-meldinkje rechtsonder in mijn scherm dat de cookies zijn verwijderd en bij opnieuw laden van de websites wordt er ook niet weer om cookie-toestemming gevraagd, ook een inlog blijft hangen. Tegelijkertijd is het rare dat ik geen cookies vermeld zie staan, ook van openstaande websites/tabbladen, als ik kijk bij Instellingen - Privacy&Beveiliging-Cookies en websitesgegevens - Gegevens beheren. Over het algemeen red ik me prima met dit soort dingen, maar nu snap ik het niet meer. Aan degene die dit leest en hier iets over kan zeggen, bij voorbaat mijn dank. Groeten van Pieter.
creator: leven1

title: Problemi di connessione
content:
Quando inizio una ricerca il motore di ricerca presenta sullo schermo l'elenco dei vari siti, clicco sul sito prescelto per aprirlo, ma mi si presenta la schermata che ho allegato (a destra la schermata della ricerca, a sinistra dopo aver cliccato la scelta). Alcune volte, dopo aver cliccato più volte "riprova" riesco ad accedere, ma quasi sempre no. Ho provato a disinstallare e reinstallare Firefox più volte, ma il risultato è sempre uguale. Con Chrome ed Edge tutto funziona regolarmente. Sono circa 20 anni che utilizzo Firefox senza mai problemi. Nelle informazioni su Firefox mi appare anche "Impossibile controllare la disponibilità di aggiornamenti.

Grazie per l'aiuto.

title: Google searches take about 30 seconds
content:
Hello,

Firefox works well except in some sites. For example, Google searches take about 30 seconds to complete. This does not always happen, only intermitently. After the first search finally returns the results, subsequent searches work as usual for some time. Then they start to take too long again.

Another site that does not work properly is Workplace, with a similar behavior when I click on some links.

The same sites work without any problem in MS Edge.

I have tried to uninstall Firefox and install again, but the problem persists.

¿Any hint?

Thanks Fran

PS: I am on a corporate PC, with Zscaler installed. However, as mentioned before, MS Edge works flawlessly.
creator: franjorge

title: Firefox Stopped Working on My Mac
content: I recently updated my Mac OS to 15.4, and for whatever reason, ever since I did, Firefox stopped working. I can open it, but if I try to go to any web site it just has a dot bouncing back and forth like it looks like it's trying to go to the site, but then it times out. I have deleted and re-installed Firefox several times - the last one being version 137.0.2 for Mac, but it still won't open any site. I don't know what to do to get it working and Mac tech support had no ideas other than to contact Mozilla tech support, so here I am. Can you help me? This has never happened before and it makes no sense that it would not work. You can see by the enclosed screen shot that it opens, but fails to open any photos or go beyond that. The 'checking for updates' alert just keeps spinning and spinning. Rick Garside

title: Failure to interconnect with 3rd party software
content:
I think I am in he correct forum - my apologies of I am "off base" but I am ignorant of computer technology I use an accounting software "reckon" - a programme that originated in America I run firefox as my default browser I run my E mails through G mail

I send invoices from reckon in PDF format attached to an e mail created in Reckon to my clients. Everything ran perfectly (and has done for years) on April 1st. Last week Reckon failed and told me I had the password wrong. (This is rubbish - as nothing has changed) After a week of talking to Reckon help desk I was told that it was Firefox/Gmail who have changed the system and will no longer accept third party interactions. (I think that is what he meant)

Can anyone give me a work round?? Other than printing and scanning and sending manually - I did this yesterday and the time it took was just mind boggling. Many Thanks for any thoughts - as I am not technically minded please be simple in your responses
creator: russell28
